title: Nicola Roberts' £1.25m mansion repossessed after 'terrifying' stalker ex ordeal

Nicole Roberts' £1.25million mansion has been repossessed after she failed to buyer for over two years.

Pop star Nicola, who bought the sparwling mansion Weybridge, Surrey, is said to be relieved to have got rid of the home, which reminded her of her stalker ex.

She confirmed the repossession was by mutual agreement and she got to collect her personal property before the bank swooped in.

Nicola moved to the three-bedroom penthouse in Surrey back in 2009 and swiftly renovated it adding a gym and a walk-in wardrobe.

(Image: WireImage)

But after it failed to sell over years the starlet agreed to hand it back to the bank and start afresh.

She told The Sun : “I had been trying to sell the house for years, and was so unhappy there that I decided to take the hit financially in order to move on and find a new property away from the bad memories. I’m really happy in my new home now.”

The ex-Girls Aloud singer, 32, slammed the Crown Prosecution Service after they failed to prosecute ex Carl Davies for breaking a lifetime restraining order.

They later apologised to the star.

(Image: (Credit too long, see caption))

At the time she said: "This is a relationship which ended 10 years ago.

"I should be able to move on from an unhealthy relationship if I want to and that has not been able to happen for me.

"You are too scared to take the dogs out for a walk because when someone plants vicious seeds you just imagine every possible outcome."

(Image: Rex Features)

Davies, a former soldier, was served with a lifetime restraining order in May 2017 after he was convicted of sending 3,000 messages to the star.

These were posted from 35 different social media accounts.

Some of the messages contained declarations of love, while others made veiled death threats.

"The messages he sent reminded me of all the terrible things that happened when we were together," Miss Roberts said in a victim impact statement.

"It was only really last year when he started threatening my friend that I realised things couldn't go on and I reported it to the police."
description: The ex Girls Aloud singer has started afresh in London after her home was repossessed
